metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6043 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Insufficient data validation in External Protocol Handler in Google Chrome prior to 64.0.3282.119 allowed a remote attacker to potentially execute arbitrary programs on user machine via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6043` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu1').
